key_insight: Spatia preserves a persistent 3D point‑cloud spatial memory and updates it via visual SLAM, using that memory to iteratively generate short video clips — enabling long‑term spatial and temporal consistency through dynamic–static disentanglement.
problem_solved: Addresses the failure of existing video generators to maintain coherent geometry and object placement over long sequences due to the dense, high‑dimensional nature of video signals.
method: Persistently store the scene as a 3D point‑cloud spatial memory to capture stable geometry.
Iteratively generate short video clips conditioned on the spatial memory to enforce local and long‑range consistency.
Continuously update the memory with visual SLAM to incorporate new views and separate dynamic objects from static scene structure.
impact: Improves long‑range coherence and geometric fidelity in generated video, making outputs more reliable for downstream uses like AR/VR content, simulators, and robotic perception datasets.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram showing: persistent 3D point‑cloud → clip generator → visual SLAM update loop

paper_title: Spatia: Video Generation with Updatable Spatial Memory
paper_authors: Jinjing Zhao, Fangyun Wei, Zhening Liu, Hongyang Zhang, Chang Xu
